item.title: DripioTerms
item.description: Dripio Terms of Use These Terms of Use (“Terms”) govern your use of the Dripio mobile application (“App”) operated by Dripio (“we,” “us,” or “our”). By accessing or using the App, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, please do not use the App. 1. Use of the App License: We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the App for personal, non-commercial purposes in accordance with these Terms.

item.title: DripioPrivacyPolicy
item.description: Dripio Privacy Policy This Privacy Policy describes how Dripio (“we,” “us,” or “our”) collects, uses, and shares your personal information when you use our mobile application (“App”). By using Dripio, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy. Information We Collect Information You Provide: When you use Dripio, we may collect information that you directly provide, such as your name, email address, and other contact information. Automatically Collected Information: We may use third-party services, including Google Analytics, to collect information about your use of the App.

item.title: Zero to Hugo
item.description: Introductionsss In this article, I’ll write about how to create your personal website or landing page or any website which you want to show to internet with Hugo and Github Pages. And ofcourse with nocode. No matter what field you work in, with a little bit of Git and Terminal knowladge, you can easily set up and deploy the site you want. If you’re ready, let’s start. First of all, what is Hugo?
